Review: Nice place to have early morning Dosa in Airport. Recommend for South Indian food.

Always crowded. Food is of average quality. Very high pricing due to its place inside airport. Very slow service. If only you have more time to spend go there.  Otherwise don't take risk. Fancy food items available at very fancy price tag that only foreigners can afford. Seating arrangement is very nice. Dress code for employees nice.

Best to eat food over here... Here u can order dosa.. Idli....n biryani.... Ur stomach will be full in 500 rupees as other restaurant foods r too costly over here..... Better to chose tiffin center n order dosa or biryani.... Veg nonveg both available over here.... Its near DTB departure SHA...i got rs. 100 rs vouchure for spending 500+ rupees... But I can use it in only 24 hours only.... So I gave it to a stranger.... Kyun jabardasti kuch aur thoosa jaaye....
Decent place to eat. Great Rasam Rice. In case you are in a hurry they have small boxes to pack it for your flight.

Heavy costly, prices are at 1:10 , poor and poverty passengers cannot afford to these heavy prices items.  Same Idli, Vada,  Bisibele bath and coffee are priced at 10 , 15 ,25  and 10 respectively at Majestic, railway station restaurants.  They are levying heavy amount from passengers who are coming from poverty backgrounds.  DGCI and IRCTC should take stern action against this hefty priced restaurants located at Aerodromes.

Staff was polite, ordered a dhosa, taste was average.
But could see this as an only option to consume south indian at banglore airport :)
Consistent taste and quality. Safe option for breakfast.

Felt it was a decent place to eat. I ordered the thali and the quality was good.
The service is very very slow though. They can improve on multiple things to make it better.

Tiffin Centre at Bangalore airport, located right beyond the Domestic Departures' Security Check, is one of the busiest food joints at this airport. And rightfully so.

It offers the widest array of South Indian cuisine, with their menu running into multiple pages akin to that of an elaborate restaurant. Ironically though, they have struck the unique and amazingly delectable pesarattu off their menu (earlier, it used to be my must-eat every single time I took off from this airport and I kind of miss it).

The food quality and presentation is quite good, with their idlis soft and fluffy, vadas crunchy and pongal loaded with cashews and bursting with authentic flavors. Their coffee is also not to be missed, in case you stop by to eat here.

On the flip side, the prices are on the higher side, which is kind of to be expected from a metro airport joint. Also there is a definite scope of improvement in their serving time, especially considering that people may be rushed for boarding their flights and they do have a huge number of service staff.

This one time, I almost had to gobble their whole breakfast thali in under 5 minutes because even after my request to be served faster and multiple follow-ups, they took their own time to serve it and then some more to settle my bill.

Located inside the bangalore airport, this restaurant is right after the security check-in counter. I think this is the only south indian cuisine choice inside kial. It's always busy in here, the food is of average taste and the price is ok for an airport restaurant.

My go to place for breakfast at Bangalore Airport. The location is pretty convenient and the service is quick. The staff is polite , efficient and well dressed üòÑ. Menu has a number of options in South Indian cuisine. Food is good and the prices are decent in airport termsüòõ. It is the busiest food place at the Bangalore Airport. Best option for a desi palate without doubt.
Good food. Value for money and wonderful. Good service. Sambar/Rasam to die for. Enjoyed the food to the fullest

This place is overpriced, but considering that it is located inside the airport, we have to accept the fact that things are priced too much. It is located in the domestic departures area of the airport after security check. More precisely ,between Gate 2 and 7. Bought podi idli from here which in my opinion was actually good. The quantity was not bad, but for the price we pay, I've no  comments.

Edit : Visited this place after ban on flights was lifted and they resumed after all the lockdown(s) due to COVID-19 pandemic. The staff were wearing gloves and masks. The place was kept highly sanitized. Digital payment was accepted. Overall experience was contactless and good.
The food is really good. And the service is very quick and lot of options for authentic South Indian food available

Teo things u can do. Sit and eat or stand and take away. Two options check the time u have for ur flight and decide. Sitting down in the morning for bf is self service and after that, it's table service. Table service will take about 10 mins. Meals are good in the afternoon. But quite repetitive and they don't even look at u once they serve u with the food as they don't wanna give u extra items to eat.

The food is average to good in taste. Morning breakfast is there with combo so u can take how much ever u want sambar and stuff. Dont get up and go to get extra sambar ask those restro guys they will get it for u with a big smile. But little money minded ppl.
Food, seating, ambience good. Service very very slow and poor. Looks like no one is bothered about customer service....only bothered about mechanically completing a task...
Worst service. Takes hours for every request. Food is great. I've no complaints on food. Go here only if you've 1 hour more time to spend for eating.
Very expensive but no way for airport travellers. You have to pay 199 for upma...160 for idli vada n all. Food is not bad. Ambiance is good.

All the stars for my fav Podi idlis here.
The place is always crowded being the only (South) Indian place at domestic terminal

Decent place, great ambiance, mostly crowded, good and tasty food. The only challenge saw was the time taken by them to serve. Not sure if it is because of the rush hours. The staff is plesent and helpful. Had the Thali for dinner. Is expensive.

Tiffin Center
Flavors from the south
Is located in the premises of bengaluru international airport
Food quality was not cross up to the mark here you will get it all the South Indian dishes like idli wada dosa and much more coconut chutney was to yummy

They serve very few items but they serve fast. I read other people complaining about prices. But that comes with the location. If you see other places inside the airport, none of them are cheap.
Their button idli is good. They serve lots of little idlis in a dipped in  coffee mug full of Sambar.
They have sugar free on the tables. But yu need to wait for a while to secure a sitting place.

Quick express service items so fresh easy to access

Billing choice of items are all quick
Space is also on the move
Loved the arrangement and the menu is predominantly South Indian dishes

Idlis vada sambar and dosa and quick service
Awesome Holiday special Kerala thali meal. We enjoyed thoroughly. Prices were very reasonable. Must for authentic food lovers.
Located inside the airport complex, at the entrance/exit area, this is a reasonably good hotel. As this hotel is inside the airport the rates are expensive which may please be noted.

Extremely slow service. The staffs are hardly bothered to take the order at table and once your are done with your food it takes long long time for the server to get the bill. Venture into it only if you have ample time to board the aircraft ! Food also not so great for the price charged..
The menu looks varied but finally we cannot get any juice, nor masala tea, nor any meal except very few ones for breakfast. A master of illusions

Food is overpriced for the portion size. It takes ages for the menu to come to your table. It takes ages for the food to come. It will take them ages to clear the table and get you the bill. Eat here if you are early to the airport and willing to waste precious time.

They dont sprepare and serve basic authentically prepared  south indian dishes. They could not offer the delicacies listed on their menu. They dont offer normal indian water also. One is forced to buy water for Rs.65 a small bottle. The service wait time is pathetic and they do not maintain clean tables also. Staff is also impolite and insensitive to customers. Authentic South Indian food & great coffee.
Awesome breakfast thali
Good preparation but slightly expensive.

Well this is the first time I am having my lunch here and I was craving for some Indian food since I could not get it for like straight 4 Months .
By appearance restaurant seems pretty good since it is in airport and maintained well with friendly staff with typical Indian attire saree and dhotis as their uniform (since they have a tag line flavours of south they opted for saree and dhoti I guess ) . Ok now the main part I simply ordered for thali with n number of sambar, saaru (May be will call it curries ) and many other as you see in the photo . You get payasam ,curd and steamed rice /tamarind rice . I fell in love with the thali (I haven‚Äôt had Indian food for long that might be one of the reasons) . I have also ordered chicken curry which was  for 99 rupees and butter milk and final bill was for whopping 774 rupees , which is very common in airports . You are obliged to pay so much .
So in general I felt the restaurant is good even though few dishes are overpriced when I went through the Menu I even saw few authentic South Indian dishes and few mangalorean dishes like kori rotti, neer dose . Seems pretty good . So if you are stopping by this is one of the place to quench your hunger
I‚Äôve had a breakfast thali here and it‚Äôs tasty.  Many items available here are Andhra. I‚Äôd definitely recommend it to someone who is wanting to try.
Short staffed. Suited booted manager hangs around in the restaurant doing nothing..you wait and wait and wait..

The worse experience ever. You end up paying close to Rs. 250 for four ( 04 ) yes 4 pieces of ‚Äúmirchi bhaji‚Äù which otherwise cost you around 25/- outside and the best part is once you think you are at least going to get the money‚Äôs worth you are greeted with just the outer layer and slices of a whole mirchi ( which should have been a whole mirchi in each in the first place ) squeezes into one. Don‚Äôt fall for this please !
Good place to have fast food. One thing to remember is keep water with you.
Good place to eat
Very poor service. For a cup of coffee and snacks have to wait for more than 45mins . Even after reminder of the order they ignored. At that time it was not crowded.
The food is great and the taste is exceptional. They hesitate in giving seconds for chutney though.
Overpriced food. The dosa made from stale batter. Regret eating here.

This place sux.They put the idli and sambar in a narrow container and the food here is very bad.Never eat here.It is seriously not worth it.It is the worst place ever.It takes Hours and hours for service.Only if you come like an hour earlier,you can eat the food(which sux) in peace.If there was a review like a no -star,then this place would hold the world record of "the most no stars achieved by a restaurant".NEVER COME HERE!!!

Nice
